meanings.definition: The amount that a shovel can hold at one time.
meanings.sent1: He filled the hole with a shovelful of dirt.
meanings.sent2: The gardener scooped up a shovelful of mulch.
meanings.sent3: The little boy pretended a shovelful of sand was a treasure chest.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like a shovelful of joy in the room.
meanings.sent5: The sunlit field was a shovelful of golden warmth.

meanings.definition: The quantity that a shovel can scoop up.
meanings.sent1: She needed a shovelful of snow to build a snowman.
meanings.sent2: The worker loaded a shovelful of gravel into the truck.
meanings.sent3: The chef added a shovelful of spices to the soup.
meanings.sent4: His words hit her heart like a shovelful of truth.
meanings.sent5: The music was a shovelful of happiness in her ears.
